list_definition.definition: to carry (people, cars etc) from one place to another by boat (or plane)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She ferried us across the river in a small boat.

list_definition.definition: a boat which ferries people, cars etc from one place to another

list_ex_of_english: Already special attention is paid to passenger ships, in particular ro-ro ferries, tankers and ships which are known to have had recent deficiencies.

The safety regulations for trains are not the same as those for ferries.
As part of the continuing process of improving safety standards, the stability regulations for passenger ferries were revised in 1980.
I have correspondence from people who have travelled on ferries from this country to the continent.
Ferries are a classic example of totally deregulated transport.
I deal first with the passenger ferries, and particularly the rates which the daily commuters are now having to face.
